TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Header extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A class representing a Message or MIME header.
Docs.remarks: Represents a single header field and value pair.

MemberSignature.Value: public Header (MimeKit.HeaderId id, string value);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype MimeKit.HeaderId id, string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new message or entity header for the specified field and value pair.

MemberSignature.Value: public Header (string field, string value);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string field, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the header field.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new message or entity header for the specified field and value pair.

MemberSignature.Value: public Header (System.Text.Encoding charset, MimeKit.HeaderId id, string value);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Text.Encoding charset, valuetype MimeKit.HeaderId id, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The charset that should be used to encode the header value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new message or entity header for the specified field and value pair. The encoding is used to determine which charset to use when encoding the value according to the rules of rfc2047.

MemberSignature.Value: public Header (System.Text.Encoding charset, string field, string value);

The name of the header field.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new message or entity header for the specified field and value pair. The encoding is used to determine which charset to use when encoding the value according to the rules of rfc2047.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Field { get; }
.property instance string Field

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the header field.
Docs.value: The name of the header field.
Docs.remarks: Represents the field name of the header.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetValue (System.Text.Encoding charset);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetValue(class System.Text.Encoding charset) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the header value using the specified charset.

remarks.para: If the raw header value does not properly encode non-ASCII text, the decoder will fall back to a default charset encoding. Sometimes, however, this default charset fallback is wrong and the mail client may wish to override that default charset on a per-header basis.
By using this method, the client is able to override the fallback charset on a per-header basis.

MemberSignature.Value: public MimeKit.HeaderId Id { get; }
.property instance valuetype MimeKit.HeaderId Id

Docs.summary: Gets the header identifier.
Docs.remarks: This property is mainly used for switch-statements for performance reasons.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<long> Offset { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<int64> Offset

Docs.summary: Gets the stream offset of the beginning of the header.
Docs.remarks: If the offset is set, it refers to the byte offset where it was found in the stream it was parsed from.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[] RawValue { get; }
.property instance unsigned int8[] RawValue

Docs.summary: Gets the raw value of the header.
Docs.value: The raw value of the header.
Docs.remarks: Contains the raw value of the header, before any decoding or charset conversion.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetValue (System.Text.Encoding charset, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetValue(class System.Text.Encoding charset, string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the header value using the specified charset.
Docs.remarks: When a particular charset is desired for encoding the header value according to the rules of rfc2047, this method should be used instead of the setter.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the header.
Docs.remarks: Formats the header field and value in a way that is suitable for display.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Unfold (string text);
.method public static hidebysig string Unfold(string text) cil managed

Docs.summary: Unfold the specified header value.
Docs.remarks: Unfolds the header value so that it becomes suitable for display. Since is already unfolded, this method is really only needed when working with raw header strings.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Value { get; set; }
.property instance string Value

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the header value.
Docs.remarks: Represents the decoded header value and is suitable for displaying to the user.
